intro: Bidens quadriseta, commonly known as the four-branched tickseed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in prairies and open woodlands. Its flowers are yellow with ray florets and are visited by various pollinators. Bidens quadriseta is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions, making it a resilient and adaptable species.
